name: places/ChIJ5eSET2dbwokR5u6y1msmSEI
formattedAddress: 52 Canal St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 52 Canal St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: I have owned a pair of Rivieras for more than 7 years no joke. It's definitely a must shoe for summer and trust me, it's SUPER comfortable. I am glad New York now has a store so I can actually walk in and try on in person. I really wish this brand can be more popular and well-known among people. This place opened very recent but it got almost all styles from classic to recent. Location is bit hard to find but it's definitely a gem of the city. Oh and boss is super nice and helpful during my shopping. 5 star for sure.

originalText.text: Absolutely love this place. It’s a great addition to the LES and has a wide variety of wonderful leisure shoes at such an affordable price. I got my first pair over two years ago and they’re still in mint condition!  Elias is super helpful and helps you find the right pair for any occasion. What I love the most about Rivieras is there is literally something for everyone and they can be dressed up or down. The basic navy/black/tan are the ones I wear to work and the fun colors/prints I wear on a night out. I’ve been buying Rivieras at Bloomingdales before this store opened and am elated that the store opened in such a convenient location as there’s a much wider variety here, including the super adorable kids collection. Love that these shoes are made in a cute little town in Spain, we need to support that! All in all, Rivieras are definitely worth checking out.

originalText.text:
In the shoes world it is rare to have confort rhyme with aesthetic but as I recently discovered,  not impossible. Wearing my Rivieras gives me that feeling of going to the beach in style.
No less amazing is to have shoes of that quality (made in Spain) landing on NYC lower east side's shelves at that price. You could get a different pair for every day of the week without breaking the bank. By visiting this store you will also have the pleasure to meet Elias, himself an import from the French Riviera!

originalText.text: Cute storefront located in the new hub of NYC LES street side dining. After enjoying an aperitif in the bus lane, step in to browse a great selection of shoes that are stylish and very comfortable. The materials are soft, and the fabric and suede styles do not require any breaking in (some of the woven styles may be better with socks for the first few wears). Perfect for taking long walks outside to escape the doldrums of quarantine life. The shoes are excellent quality and you can tell they will last many seasons, but even if you want to switch them out regularly, buying a couple pairs won’t break the bank. Tested my beige suede ones out during a long and grueling moving process and happy to report  they held up well, didn’t scuff or get dirty. Also took a 5+ mile walk with no issues and not a single blister in sight. Definitely going to get more in the suede leather and hope they’ll make more colors in that style. Customer service is top notch and can’t beat the price for what you get. Shoes are designed in France but made in Spain.

originalText.text: Fantastic shoes and services.  I bought three pairs and they are extremely comfortable and fashionable; can walk and stand in them all day long.  Elias is a great owner and salesman.
